qas.question: The State of Israel is divided into how many administrative districts?
What are these districts known as?

context: The State of Israel is divided into <a0_0>six<a0_0/> main administrative districts, known as <a1_0>mehozot<a1_0/> (מחוזות; singular: mahoz) – Center, Haifa, Jerusalem, North, Southern, and Tel Aviv Districts, as well as the Judea and Samaria Area in the West Bank. All of the Judea and Samaria Area and parts of the Jerusalem and North districts are not recognized internationally as part of Israel. Districts are further divided into <a2_0>fifteen<a2_0/> sub-districts known as nafot (נפות; singular: nafa), which are themselves partitioned into fifty natural regions.
